required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pain Response to Cannabidiol in Opioid-induced Hyperalgesia, Acute Nociceptive Pain and Allodynia By Using a Model Mimicking Acute Pain in Healthy Adults
clinical_study.official_title: Pain Response to Cannabidiol in Opioid-induced Hyperalgesia, Acute Nociceptive Pain and Allodynia By Using a Model Mimicking Acute Pain in Healthy Adults

brief_summary.textblock: Prospective, randomized, placebo-controlled, double-blinded, crossover study to investigate the effect of cannabidiol (CBD) on remifentanil-induced hyperalgesia in healthy volunteers in a well-established acute pain model. Participants are randomized according to the order of the two treatments (CBD + Remifentanil or Placebo + Remifentanil).

detailed_description.textblock:
Opioid-induced hyperalgesia (OIH) is a clinically often neglected, but well described phenomenon. OIH could also be shown for Remifentanil in an acute pain model. As CBD showed antihyperalgesic potential in the animal model, this brings up the question if CBD might be used to prevent or diminish OIH. Until today there are no studies investigating CBD as an adjunct to remifentanil or other opioids regarding the OIH. This is however of great clinical value because CBD with its possible antihyperalgesic effect on the OIH might be a worthful adjunct for opioid based anaesthesia and analgesia.
Every participant will pass through two interventions with electrically induced pain (Koppert model). CBD will be applied orally at the beginning of the intervention. Pain, allodynia and hyperalgesia will be assessed and recorded every 10 min during the remifentanil infusion and afterwards.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in hyperalgesia measured by the area under the curve (AUCHyper)
primary_outcome.time_frame: from minute 100 to minute 160 after termination of remifentanil infusion
primary_outcome.description: Change in hyperalgesia measured by the area under the curve (AUCHyper)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in pain response (NRS) measured by the area under the curve (AUCNRS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from minute 70 to minute 90 during remifentanil infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Change in pain response (NRS) measured by the area under the curve (AUCNRS)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in hyperalgesia measured by the area under the curve (AUCHyper)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from minute 70 to minute 90 during remifentanil infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Change in hyperalgesia measured by the area under the curve (AUCHyper)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in allodynia measured by the area under the curve (AUCAllo)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from minute 70 to minute 90 during remifentanil infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Change in allodynia measured by the area under the curve (AUCAllo)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in pain response (NRS) measured by the area under the curve (AUCNRS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from minute 100 to minute 160 after termination of remifentanil infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Change in pain response (NRS) measured by the area under the curve (AUCNRS)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in allodynia measured by the area under the curve (AUCAllo)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from minute 100 to minute 160 after termination of remifentanil infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Change in allodynia measured by the area under the curve (AUCAllo)

arm_group.description: CBD 800 mg p.o. + Remifentanil 0.1 µg/kg/min i.v. for 30 min
Placebo p.o + Remifentanil 0.1 µg/kg/min i.v. for 30 min

intervention.description: 800mg cannabidiol, single oral dose (8 ml oily solution)
Placebo p.o, single oral dose (8 ml oily solution)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- BMI between 18.5 until 25 kg/m2
- Able to give informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Regular consumption of cannabinoids or other drugs / substances
- Regular intake of medications potentially interfering with pain sensation (analgesics, antihistamines, calcium and potassium channel blockers, serotonin / noradrenaline reuptake inhibitors, corticosteroids)
- Neuropathy
- Chronic pain
- Neuromuscular disease
- Psychiatric disease
- Known or suspected kidney or liver disease
- Pregnancy (cf. 8.6 Trial specific preventive measures) / Lactation
- Allergy / hypersensitivity to cannabidiol
- Contraindications for Remifentanil (e.g. hypersensitivity)

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Anaesthesiology, University Hospital of Basel

facility.name: Department of Anaesthesiology, University Hospital of Basel (USB)
